div.p: The authors would like to acknowledge the Wildland Resource Department and the Ecology Center at Utah State University, along with the Department of Fish, Wildlife, and Conservation Biology and the Graduate Degree Program in Ecology at Colorado State University, for logistic and academic support. This research was supported by the Utah Agricultural Experiment Station at Utah State University (Project #01246), the National Geographic Research and Exploration Grant (#9396‚Äê13), and discretionary funds from the Warner College of Natural Resources at Colorado State University. We appreciate Dr. Norm Slade for sharing data and his extensive knowledge about the system, Scott Bernhardt and Susannah French for their assistance in initiating data collection, and Lucas Henzler and Haylie Hill for their help with fieldwork.
